Job Posting:173049 - Position: W26 Student, Quality Engineering DevOps Specialist 173049 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/16/2025 11:59 PM Through Employer Website 09/10/2025 04:18 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Sun Life Canada Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Student, Quality Engineering DevOps Specialist 173049 Co-op Position Various Locations, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Student, Quality Engineering DevOps Specialist (Winter 2026) JR00114107 Posting End Date: 16/09/2025 Location: • Toronto, Ontario Waterloo, Ontario • Our student and new graduate programs offer a chance to explore Sun Life from the inside. You'll make a difference in the lives of our customers and communities, while building the skills and experience that allow you to grow in a meaningful and rewarding way. Job Description: Are you passionate about quality assurance, automation, and DevOps? We have an exciting opportunity for a student to join our dynamic team and gain hands-on experience in software testing and development operations. About The Role: The QE DevOps team is an integral part of the Quality Engineering Platform, which provides automated testing tools to development teams, driving efficiency and increasing velocity in testing. The QE DevOps team is currently developing GenAI applications, including development in front-end and back-end utilizing AWS services such as Bedrock and Lambda. In this role, the successful candidate will assist in UI development and modifications to existing data collection processes. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute and learn with an innovative and supportive team. What You'll Learn and Do: • Collaborate with QA and Development teams to understand and contribute to quality assurance strategies • Explore current technologies used in the company and brainstorm improvement ideas • Participate in an agile team to support product feature delivery • Learn about automation and quality practices within Agile environments • Shadow DevOps professionals and assist in enhancing QE DevOps pipelines for QE Automation Tools Learn about and contribute to UI development within a QE focused Agile team • What's in it for you: • At Sun Life, you will be joining a purpose driven organization focused on helping Canadian's achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives. • As a student, you'll make a real impact by contributing to meaningful work, gaining valuable experience and actively working towards your team's goals. • You'll join our unique student culture, designed to help you grow both personally and professionally beyond your role. • We offer professional development workshops, student awards, socials and many more exciting opportunities. • We are honored to be recognized as Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates and Canada's Best Workplaces by Great Place to Work in 2025. • Your student journey is just the beginning and we're proud to help many who choose Sun Life to transition into permanent roles after graduation. Job Requirements What You Need to Succeed: • Enrolled in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field • Basic understanding of software development and testing concepts • • Eagerness to learn about Agile methodologies and test automation Familiarity with at least one programming language, Python or Javascript preferred • Interest in cloud technologies, continuous integration, and DevOps practices • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities Curiosity and enthusiasm for continuous learning • This opportunity is available to students with an April 2026 or later graduation date. Preferred Skills: • Basic knowledge of UI development using React JS • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) • Familiarity with AWS foundations • Basic understanding of CI/CD concepts • Exposure to data collection automation using Python • Familiarity with Agile ceremonies and work processes Experience working with an Integrated Development Environment (IDE), Visual Studio Code preferred • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://sunlife.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Campus/job/Toronto-Ontario/Student--Quality-Engineering-DevOps-Specialist-- Winter-2026-_JR00114107 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
